result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly D. Dray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete either anger management or domestic abuse education program at the discretion of the agent.

Have no contact with the victim except as permitted by the agent.

Pay costs.  (If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)

Submit a DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kelly D. Dray in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states plea agreement.  Def pleads no contest to counts 2 and 3, both with the charge modifiers.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Victim addresses Court.  DA - victim is asking for no contact as a condition of probation.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  2 years probation with conditions that he attend, pay for, and succ. complete either anger mgt or d.a. program at discretion of agent; have no contact with victim except as permitted by agent; 1 day credit in event of revocation.  Costs.  DNA sample to be submitted at jail before he signs up for probation.  Count 1 dismissed/read in.
Defendant's Motion to Extend Time to File Pretrial Motions

Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court with Defendant Kelly D. Dray. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Waive reading, plead NG, waive 20 day time period on prelim. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Court accepts waiver of time periods, orders NG pleas on 2 & 3, withhold on 1-defense wants to attack the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
